There is a small organized Jewish community in Montenegro. The 2007 Montenegrin Statistical Yearbook lists 12 Jews in the country, spread across nine towns.[1] There is little evidence of a significant historic Jewish presence in the country.[2]

See also[edit]

  • Montenegro portal
  • Religion in Montenegro
  • History of the Jews in Serbia

References[edit]

  1. ^ 2007 Statistical Yearbook of Montenegro, p238
  2. ^ "Antisemitism and Jewish Identity in Serbia after the 1991 Collapse of the Yugoslav State", Laslo Sekelj

  • Jewish community in Yugoslavia and Montenegro, World Jewish Congress
